intro: Ardisia polydactyla, commonly known as the many-fingered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Following flowering, it develops bright red berries that are attractive to birds and other wildlife. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
